DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Original Anatomic Site Uberon Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The location within the body from which a specimen was originally obtained as captured in the Uberon identifier.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:Preceding all others in time or being as first made or performed._Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or being as first made or performed._Named locations of or within the body.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or being as first made or performed.
Named locations of or within the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A symbol or combination of symbols and characters to capture the UBERON anatomic site code (ex: UBERON:0006209 or UBERON_0006209)._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data.

Concepts.definition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRDC Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description:
1. Go to https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/uberon
2. Use the search field to search for your term. 
3. Use the Copy button at the top of the search results to copy the Uberon ID.
